condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 6.2: Increased capacity of communities and families in target districts to practise behaviours and demonstrate attitudes which protect children from violence, abuse and exploitation.

description.narrative: UNICEF intensified efforts to address social norms condoning violence against children and strengthened the capacity of communities and families to protect children through an increased number of parents reached with information and messages that address violence against children; UNICEF reached 40,241 parents in 2019 (surpassing the target of 30,000). Furthermore, a total of 15,438 adolescents (5,348 boys & 10,090 girls) were reached with information and skills to say no to violence and seek help. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:13/01/2020

title.narrative: Number of adolescent girls receiving prevention or care intervention to address child marriage through UNICEF-supported programmes (COMPACT 431)

actual.value: 2019:11 to 17-year-old boys from 30-50% and girls from 41%-60%
